reviewText: 4 stories, each about 20 minutes.  While the stories are engaging, overall it doesn't move fast enough for me to use with my Religious Ed teenagers - they would get restless.  But they get restless easily.

No matter what we're going through, it helps to know that there's a God in heaven that cares about us personally.  This movie tells four true stories about life and death, financial concerns and even a story where God doesn't answer a prayer as hoped for.  It's a film that offered new insights into the topic of miracles and faith.  Highly recommended!
Very inspiring.  These are real people who experienced God's power at work in their lives.
so boring.could not relate to these culture created predictive programs.

Wow! I love to hear stories about how the Lord works in each of our lives in different ways. I loved the 4 stories depicted in this video. In the 1st story, I was in awe about how the Lord went to very extreme and unusual methods to get the desired end result. In the 2nd story, I was inspired to see the faith of the young lady, and how she put God to the test every day, and He came through. In the 3rd story, it was quite a testimony to see how the lady followed God's prompting, and how it saved her life. In the 4th story, the prayers for Neville Peter were not answered, as God has other beautiful plans in mind. And Neville has the most angelic voice I have ever heard. Thank you for this video! God is always at work, and if we will keep our eyes open we will see blessing and miracles He is working in our lives, and the lives of those around us.
TAKE DELIGHT IN THE LORD AND HE WILL GIVE YOU THE DESIRES OF YOUR HEART.

This documentary shares stories of "regular" people who faced great challenges; each circumstance was very different. Each one comes to experience a God MUCH bigger than themselves! Have watched other documentaries on miracles and been disappointed. This one doesn't disappoint. This one is what miracles stories should be like! Fast -paced. Well documented. Good experts testify as to "why." Surveillance footage from actual events. This is real. Truly touching. Heart-warming. You will be inspired and encouraged as you watch this film. Found the last segment the most moving...because it deals with getting a miracle that is not the miracle prayed for; yet turns out to be a bigger miracle. Not going to spoil the film for you---go watch it!!
Inspiring

I found all four stories powerful, undeniable, and inspiring, each in its own way. I wanted to add that beyond this, the discovery of Neville Peter, an unbelievably angelic and talented singer and songwriter was the icing on the cake. He has two marvelous albums I ordered that will make you glad to be alive: Simply Hymn 1 and Messages From the Throne of Grace. I can't tell you how badly I needed to see and hear this- both the video and the music embody God's grace and love.

Well done documentary. Combines interviews with the real people and re-enactments of the stories they are telling.
The first story was about a guy who was shot in the head, his miraculous recovery, and how God used it for good in more AMAZING ways (which I won't tell less I ruin the surprise :) ).
The second story tells about a girl who is trying to raise money to go to China, her faith in God, and how God came through for her in exact answers to her prayers.
The third story tells how a woman was told by God to go to the emergency room right away. She did, even though she had no symptoms. As she walked through the doors, she had a brain aneurysm. Her life was spared through the series of events that followed, all because she obeyed God in the first place.
The fourth story tells of a blind man, who is still blind, but whose blindness released a way for him to pursue music.
Very interesting and well done.
